Description: Fragment of neck and flattened handle to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 158 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Timourrodos. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0243.38 and Athenian Agora SS 11242.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (266)
